intro: Erythroxylum pauciflorum, commonly known as the few-flowered erythroxylum, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Erythroxylaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features include a woody stem and small, hairy leaves that are often alternate in arrangement. It is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
